Package de.rumford.tradingsystem.helper

Class Validator

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.rumford.tradingsystem.helper.Validator
  • public class Validator
extends Object
    Validator class as used throughout the library containing solely of static methods representing validation of input values.
    Author:
    Max Rumford

    • Method Detail

      • validateArrayOfDoubles

        public static void validateArrayOfDoubles​(double[] values)
        Validates the given array of arrays.
        • Must not be null.
        Parameters:
        values - double[] The array to be validated.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if any of the above specifications are not met.

      • validateBaseValue

        public static void validateBaseValue​(BaseValue baseValue)
        Validates the given BaseValue.
        • Must not be null.
        Parameters:
        baseValue - BaseValue The base value to be validated.

      • validateCorrelations

        public static void validateCorrelations​(double[] correlations)
        Validates the given correlations.
        Parameters:
        correlations - double[] Correlations to be validated. Must not be null. Must have a length of 3. Must only contain values !Double.NaN and -1 <= value <= 1.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the above specifications are not met.

      • validateDates

        public static void validateDates​(ValueDateTupel[] values)
        Validates if the given array of ValueDateTupel is sorted in an ascending order.
        Parameters:
        values - ValueDateTupel[] The given array of values.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the specifications above are not met.

      • validatePositiveDouble

        public static void validatePositiveDouble​(double value)
        Validates the given double value. The value must meet the following specifications:
        • Must not be Double.NaN.
        • Must be a positive decimal.
        Parameters:
        value - double The value to validate.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the above specifications are not met.

      • validateRules

        public static void validateRules​(Rule[] rules)
        Validates the given Array of Rule. Must meet the following specifications:
        • Must not be null.
        • Must not be an empty array.
        Parameters:
        rules - Rule[] The Array of Rule to be validated.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the above specifications are not met.

      • validateRulesVsBaseValue

        public static void validateRulesVsBaseValue​(Rule[] rules,
                                            BaseValue baseValue)
        Validates the given array of Rule against the given BaseValue.
        • All rules must have the given BaseValue as their own BaseValue.
        Parameters:
        rules - Rule[] The array of Rule to be validated.
        baseValue - BaseValue The BaseValue to be validated.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if any of the above specifications are not met.

      • validateTimeWindow

        public static void validateTimeWindow​(LocalDateTime startOfTimeWindow,
                                      LocalDateTime endOfTimeWindow,
                                      ValueDateTupel[] values)
        Validates the given time window values. Values are needed for checking of containment. Must meet the following specifications:
        • startOfTimeWindow must not be null.
        • endOfTimeWindow must not be null.
        • endOfTimeWindow must be after startOfTimeWindow. See LocalDateTime.isAfter(java.time.chrono.ChronoLocalDateTime).
        • values must contain startOfTimeWindow.
        • values must contain endOfTimeWindow.
        Parameters:
        startOfTimeWindow - LocalDateTime The start of Time window to be checked.
        endOfTimeWindow - LocalDateTime The end of Time window to be checked.
        values - ValueDateTupel[] The array of ValueDateTupel to be checked.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if any of the above specifications are not met.

      • validateValues

        public static void validateValues​(ValueDateTupel[] values)
        Validates the given array of ValueDateTupel. The given array must fulfill the following specifications:
        • Must not be null
        • Must be of length greater than 0
        • Must not contain null
        • Must not contain NaNs as values
        Parameters:
        values - ValueDateTupel[] The values to be validated.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the given array does not meet the above specifications.

      • validateVariations

        public static void validateVariations​(Rule[] variations,
                                      LocalDateTime startOfReferenceWindow,
                                      LocalDateTime endOfReferenceWindow,
                                      BaseValue baseValue)
        Validates the given variations array of Rule against the given LocalDateTime values for startOfReferenceWindow and endOfReferenceWindow and the given BaseValue. Must fulfill the following specifications:
        • Must not be of length greater than 3.
        • Must not be of length 0.
        • Elements must not be null.
        • Elements' Rule.getStartOfReferenceWindow() must equal the given startOfReferenceWindow.
        • Elements' Rule.getEndOfReferenceWindow() must equal the given endOfReferenceWindow.
        • Must pass validateRulesVsBaseValue(Rule[], BaseValue).
        Parameters:
        variations - Rule[] An array of Rule representing a rules' variations.
        startOfReferenceWindow - LocalDateTime The start of reference window of the Rule containing the given variations.
        endOfReferenceWindow - LocalDateTime The end of reference window of the Rule containing the given variations.
        baseValue - BaseValue The base value of the Rule containing the given variations.
